title: About Formlos PlayR
content:
[www.formlos.net/formlosTypeFoundry/formlos\_PlayR.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125223/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTypeFoundry/formlos_PlayR.htm)  
Mr. David Hubner & typophiles, I have an aesthetic question:   
what is the idea behind the fittings of "PlayR" new font?   
Best,   
AS
author: as8

comments.content:
Alessandro, I am not too sure if I understand your question correctly..   
   
Are you asking what its usable for.? ( Or if its usable at all.? )   
What do you think.? Do you like it.? Why / Why not.? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
_( Its a 'fun' display type.. Nothing too serious at all.. Its just something I wanted to do for quite some time now.. The original idea and scribbles were created more than two years ago.. Originally for a different font, named 'Play' and this may be the remixed version, then.. 'formlos PlayR'.. )_

Mr. David Hubner:   
my question is about the idea behind the fittings,   
the color spots where some strokes meet one another.   
It looks so uneven that I might think that it works better   
printed at 5 pt. Or then why you didn`t planned this pimple   
for all the letters? Now it is aesthetically unpleasant.   
 \> Are you asking what its usable for? What do you think?   
No, but to answer you I think that it could denote certain   
new synthetic music styles or cosmetics for pimples :-)   
(No offence, I am joking). If I like it?   
I don`t because it is a pity that intending to design a light   
& delicate typeface you ended up working on the black instead   
that on the white, or am I wrong? I mean: "Write the story.   
Take out all the good lines, and see if it still works."   
Best,   
AS

Thank you, Mr. Alessandro Segalini.. I think I see ( some of ) your points..   
Still, this is an experimental typeface, a 'fun' display face, like I stated before..   
   
_( Sure.: Some may like it, some may not.. )_

Hello Mr. David Hubner:   
you could make a second remix of PlayR in the future   
to make it a text font, I think I would like to check it   
printed at small bodies, say 9 to 5 pt.   
I like when someone post something in the "News & Events"   
even more if who does is not a big and famous foundry   
(nothing against foundries being big);   
I am saying this because in my experience the good things   
come from the cellar so that was also a question about   
your cellar.   
Best,   
AS

Thank you.. I am also working on a few faces, intended for text use..   
And maybe there will really be a ( more usable ) version of 'Play' / 'PlayR' in the near future..   
_( As I am currently in the 'Think, Scribble & Design' process, this may still take some time.. )_   
   
And, I am pretty happy and excited about being able to release my type experiments and fonts under my own 'Cellar Type Foundry'.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125223im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) _( Even if the 'exposure' and the audience may not be as big as being a 'featured' type designer, at other famous font foundries.. )_
